Package edu.mit.lib.bagit

Package contains a lightweight java library to support creation and consumption of BagIt-packaged content, as specified by the BagIt IETF Draft Spec version 0.97.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Bag
    Bag represents a rudimentary bag conformant to LC Bagit spec - version 0.97.
    Bagger
    Bagger is a command-line interface to the BagIt library.
    Filler
    Filler is a builder class used to construct bags conformant to LC Bagit spec - version 0.97.
    Loader
    Loader is a Bag builder class that interprets bag serializations and other manfestations as Bags.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Bag.MetadataName
    Reserved metadata property names
    Filler.EolRule
    Rule for assigning the EOL (line termination/separation)

Package edu.mit.lib.bagit Description

Package contains a lightweight java library to support creation and consumption of BagIt-packaged content, as specified by the BagIt IETF Draft Spec version 0.97. It represents an 'unconditionally compliant' implementation. It requires a Java 8 or better JRE to run, has a single dependency on the Apache commons compression library for support of tarred Gzip archive format (".tgz"), and is Apache 2 licensed. The library attempts to simplify a few of the most common use cases/patterns involving bag packages. The first (the 'producer' pattern) is where content is assembled and placed into a bag, and the bag is then serialized for transport/hand-off to another component or system. The library ensures that the constructed bag is correct. The second (the 'consumer' pattern) is where a bag serialization (or a loose directory) is given and must be interpreted and validated for use.
